name: Lorraine Baines
description: Mother of Marty McFly, central character in the McFly family's storyline.

content.title: Background
content.body: Lorraine Baines was born and raised in Hill Valley, where she lived with her family. She met her future husband, George McFly, during high school at the *Enchantment Under the Sea Dance*, an event that played a pivotal role in ensuring her future with him.

content.title: Personality
content.body: Lorraine is depicted as caring and loving, though somewhat naive and disillusioned with life at times. She believes in the good old days, reminiscing about her youth, but she displays determination and courage when faced with challenges. She can be protective of her family and demonstrates strong moral values.

content.title: Story Role
content.body: Lorraine serves as a key figure in the narrative, especially in her high school years where her relationship with George is crucial to the timeline. Her interactions with Marty, who travels back in time, are central to the plot of the first movie. She unknowingly becomes romantically interested in Marty, which complicates his mission to ensure his own existence.

content.title: Relationships
content.body:
- **George McFly**: Lorraine's husband, whom she originally fell in love with during high school.
- **Marty McFly**: Lorraine's son, whose actions are pivotal to her past and future.
- **Biff Tannen**: Often an antagonist in her life, threatening her relationship with George in different timelines.

links.title: Lorraine Baines - Back to the Future Wiki
